entries.name: httpdate(date)
entries.desc: Parses date as an HTTP-date defined by RFC 2616 and converts it to a Time object.

entries.name: parse(date, now=self.now)
entries.desc: Takes a string representation of a Time and attempts to parse it using a heuristic.

entries.name: rfc2822(date)
entries.desc: Parses date as date-time defined by RFC 2822 and converts it to a Time object.  The format is identical to the date format defined by RFC 822 and updated by RFC 1123.

entries.name: strptime(date, format, now=self.now)
entries.desc: Works similar to parse except that instead of using a heuristic to detect the format of the input string, you provide a second argument that describes the format of the string.

entries.name: xmlschema(date)
entries.desc: Parses date as a dateTime defined by the XML Schema and converts it to a Time object.  The format is a restricted version of the format defined by ISO 8601.

entries.name: zone_offset(zone, year=self.now.year)
entries.desc: Return the number of seconds the specified time zone differs from UTC.

entries.name: httpdate()
entries.desc: Returns a string which represents the time as RFC 1123 date of HTTP-date defined by RFC 2616:

entries.name: rfc2822()
entries.desc: Returns a string which represents the time as date-time defined by RFC 2822:

entries.name: xmlschema(fraction_digits=0)
entries.desc: Returns a string which represents the time as a dateTime defined by XML Schema:
